column4: what's a decent html editor that can be done with gui vs directly with the code?
I want a partition for my files incase I have to re-install. I was going to just merge the free space but decided not to

that's the preferred setup, yes, usuallly from the getgo, you make a small partition for your system and apps, and others for your docs and media... and I'd just grab the free space, make a partition off it and dump my files there
could I do the same for newly installed programs?
to tell the app to install to that partition?   if the app gives you such choice, or is standalone, yes
I'm afraid with the number of updates and new programs that I'll run out of space on 17 gb easily
ie, Firefox the one you download from mozilla.org comes in a bz2 package, and is standalone, you can pretty much dump it anywhere and will run from there, no installation needed
not all compiled packages will run standalone, I mean,the ones you do a 'make install' on them, they usually move stuff over system folders
so the ones that just compile without doing make-install are standalone
those..... I'd think they may yes
my only issue with compiling source packages is finding the proper deps, that seems to be a headache often
well, it comes with the territory :)
